question.title: Will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extra terrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) We will detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030, and (2) Europa will not be the first place humanity discovers extraterrestrial life if it is discovered before 2045?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030, and if humanity does not discover convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, or if it does so after detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as Yes. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) We find life on Mars by 2050 and (b) Europa is not the first place humanity discovers extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur:
(a) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050.
(b) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life anywhere other than Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life on Europa. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly on Europa prior to anywhere else, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
If either of these conditions is not met, this question will resolve as No.

question.title: Will US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question

Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880, according to NASA data. (2) At any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is 75 years or more, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the second question.

(b) By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040? (b) A global thermonuclear war by 2070?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs:
(a) US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) falls below 75 years at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.
(b) There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
- Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
- Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway.

The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) At least two public health agencies claim that China deliberately misreported COVID-19 infections before 2025? (2) Neither of the following is true: (a) There will be a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120; (b) There will be less than 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Before January 1, 2025, at least two of the specified public health agencies claim that it is more likely than not that the Chinese government deliberately lied about, fabricated, or misrepresented case or death numbers related to COVID-19. (2) Neither of the following occurs: (a) There is a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading; (b) By January 1, 2100, there has not been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. 
For the first condition, the relevant public health agencies are: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control, World Health Organization, and others listed previously. For the second condition, data for resolution shall come from NASA for global temperature.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Will there be a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120? (b) Before 2025, will at least two public health agencies claim that China deliberately misreported COVID-19 infections?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if either of the following is true: (a) There is a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading. (b) Before January 1, 2025, at least two of the public health agencies listed below claim that it is more likely than not that the Chinese government deliberately lied about, fabricated, or misrepresented case or death numbers: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (including the Epidemic Intelligence Service), The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (including the Health Threat Unit), World Health Organization, The Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention, The Centre for Health Protection, Robert Koch Institute, The National Institute of Infectious Diseases, Public Health England, The National Centre for Infectious Diseases, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Korea, The Public Health Agency of Canada. 
Fine Print
For (a), we'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia: The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place. For (b), the relevant assessments will count if they are judged by Metaculus to broadly state that it is more likely than not that the Chinese government deliberately did lie about, fabricate, or misrepresent case or death counts.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The USA enters a second civil war before 2031 (b) There is never a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:
(a) The USA enters a second civil war before January 1, 2031. This will be determined if all of the following conditions are met before January 1, 2031:
- The Insurrection Act is invoked.
- While the Insurrection Act is invoked, there are at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches.
- All of these deaths occur in any US state(s) (including DC).
Any conflicts between the US military and the armed forces of another country will be excluded from consideration in this question. Conflicts between the US military and US residents, possibly supported by other nations with weapons or resources, will be included. Conflicts between civilians and local police will not be included, unless there are active armed forces in the region providing mutual support. Deaths are calculated among all of the states (and Washington, DC) in the United States. New states which are admitted shall be included, states which secede or are removed, will not be included. Suicides do not count towards the death count.
(b) There is never a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120. This will be determined if there is never a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading. We'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive): The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050 (b) At least one of the following occurs: (i) The USA does not enter a second civil war before 2031 (ii) There is at least one full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:
1. Armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before January 1, 2050. This will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2021 to January 1, 2050, either of the following occur:
   - There are at least three credible government sources reporting at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
   - There are at least three credible news reports that at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
   These 100 deaths do not have to occur in the same conflict or the same year; it is sufficient for multiple separate events to reach a total of 100 deaths in this period.
   This question resolves as No otherwise.

2. At least one of the following conditions is met:
   (i) The USA does not enter a second civil war before January 1, 2031. This will be determined if not all of the following conditions are met before January 1, 2031:
   - The Insurrection Act is invoked.
   - While the Insurrection Act is invoked, there are at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches.
   - All of these deaths occur in any US state(s) (including DC).
   Any conflicts between the US military and the armed forces of another country will be excluded from consideration in this question. Conflicts between the US military and US residents, possibly supported by other nations with weapons or resources, will be included. Conflicts between civilians and local police will not be included, unless there are active armed forces in the region providing mutual support. Deaths are calculated among all of the states (and Washington, DC) in the United States. New states which are admitted shall be included, states which secede or are removed, will not be included. Suicides do not count towards the death count.
   (ii) There is at least one full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120. This will be determined if there is a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading. We'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive): The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.

(b) At any time between January 1, 2021 to January 1, 2050, there are at least three credible government sources reporting at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths, or there are at least three credible news reports that at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths. not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The USA does not enter a second civil war before 2031 (b) There is always a full year with an open stock exchange in the US by 2120 or (c) There will not be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if none of the following conditions are met:
(a) The USA does not enter a second civil war before January 1, 2031. This will be determined if none of the following conditions are met before January 1, 2031:
- The Insurrection Act is not invoked.
- While the Insurrection Act is not invoked, there are not at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches.
- None of these deaths occur in any US state(s) (including DC).
Any conflicts between the US military and the armed forces of another country will be excluded from consideration in this question. Conflicts between the US military and US residents, possibly supported by other nations with weapons or resources, will be included. Conflicts between civilians and local police will not be included, unless there are active armed forces in the region providing mutual support. Deaths are calculated among all of the states (and Washington, DC) in the United States. New states which are admitted shall be included, states which secede or are removed, will not be included. Suicides do not count towards the death count.
(b) There is always a full year with an open stock exchange in the US by 2120. This will be determined if there is always a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are public US stock exchanges open for trading. We'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive): The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.
(c) There will not be a major famine in North Korea before 2025. This will resolve as Yes in the event that before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has not suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if this does occur.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) There will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, and (2) Neither of the following will occur: (a) a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120, nor (b) the USA enter a second civil war before 2031?
Q_and_not_P.body:
(1) Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050, and (b) neither a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120 nor the USA entering a second civil war before 2031?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:
1. There are at least three credible government sources or three credible news reports confirming that armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China have led to a total of at least 100 deaths at any time between January 1, 2021 and January 1, 2050.
2. It is not the case that there is a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120, and it is also not the case that the USA enters a second civil war before January 1, 2031, which means that either:
   - There is a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which public US stock exchanges are open for trading, or
   - The Insurrection Act is invoked, or there are at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military or national guard, with all such deaths occurring in US states or DC.

   - The Insurrection Act is invoked, or there are at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military or national guard, with all such deaths occurring in US states or DC.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120, (b) the USA enter a second civil war before 2031, or (c) armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?
P_or_Q.body:
(a) Will there be a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120?
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if there is a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading.
Fine Print
We'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive):
The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.

(b) Will the USA enter a second civil war before 2031?
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following conditions are met before January 1, 2031:
The Insurrection Act is invoked.
While the Insurrection Act is invoked, there are at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches.
All of these deaths occur in any US state(s) (including DC).
Fine Print
Any conflicts between the US military and the armed forces of another country will be excluded from consideration in this question. Conflicts between the US military and US residents, possibly supported by other nations with weapons or resources, will be included.
Conflicts between civilians and local police will not be included, unless there are active armed forces in the region providing mutual support.
Deaths are calculated among all of the states (and Washington, DC) in the United States. New states which are admitted shall be included, states which secede or are removed, will not be included. Suicides do not count towards the death count.

(c) Will armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2021 to January 1, 2050, either of the following occur:
There are at least three credible government sources reporting at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
There are at least three credible news reports that at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
These 100 deaths do not have to occur in the same conflict or the same year; it is sufficient for multiple separate events to reach a total of 100 deaths in this period.
This question will resolves as No otherwise.
In the context of this question, an armed conflict will be defined as a dispute that concerns a government and/or territory where the use of armed force between two parties, of which at least one is the government of a state, results in an exchange of weapon fire or detonations.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) There be a major famine in North Korea before 2025, and (2) Neither of the following occur: (a) a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120, (b) the USA enter a second civil war before 2031, nor (c) armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?
Q_and_not_P.body:
(1) Will there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes in the event that before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if this does not occur.

(2) Will neither of the following occur: (a) a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120, (b) the USA enter a second civil war before 2031, nor (c) armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?
Resolution Criteria
(a) Will there be no full year with open stock exchanges in the US by 2120?
This question will resolve positively if there is no period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are public US stock exchanges open for trading.

(b) Will the USA not enter a second civil war before 2031?
This question will resolve as Yes if any of the following conditions are not met before January 1, 2031:
The Insurrection Act is not invoked.
While the Insurrection Act is not invoked, there are not at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches.
Any of these deaths do not occur in any US state(s) (including DC).

(c) Will armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China not lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2021 to January 1, 2050, neither of the following occur:
There are not at least three credible government sources reporting at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
There are not at least three credible news reports that at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
These 100 deaths do not have to occur in the same conflict or the same year; it is sufficient for multiple separate events to not reach a total of 100 deaths in this period.
